comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Pier,_Blackpool includes a recent aerial shot of the pier and some history. And, from www.theheritagetrail.co.uk/piers/blackpool%20north%20pier... "Grade II listed, Blackpool North Pier today is considered the most traditional of the three Blackpool Piers. It retains much of its Victorian splendour and is devoted to the gentler pursuits of promenading and sun bathing rather than the brasher entertainment offered by its newer companions."

comment.author: 9003948@N05
comment._content: Also showing original electric trams - the first in Britain. Line opened 1885. Unfortunately they chose conduit current collection (electricity was picked up from a 'live' rail in a slot between the tracks). This was not a success due to sand and seawater getting in the slot. The line was subsequently reconstructed with conventional overhead wire current collection. Trams still run today.
